channel.title: Comments on: Creating Custom Color Palettes in SSRS Charts
channel.description: A Technical Community for IT Professionals

item.title: By: Jes Borland
item.dc:creator: Jes Borland
item.description: Jacque, I haven't. (I don't use SSRS much anymore.) However, there are a lot of enhancements coming to SSRS in 2016, so it may be possible soon.
item.content:encoded: Jacque, I haven’t. (I don’t use SSRS much anymore.) However, there are a lot of enhancements coming to SSRS in 2016, so it may be possible soon.

item.title: By: Jacque
item.dc:creator: Jacque
item.description:
Hi vee, I think this site has what you're looking for. https://www.mssqltips.com/sqlservertip/3586/sql-server-reporting-services-multilayer-pie-charts/#comments
Hi Jes, I'm wondering if you've come up with a way to save the custom color palette since this article was from a couple of years ago. I'm using 2014. Thanks,
item.content:encoded:
Hi vee, I think this site has what you’re looking for. https://www.mssqltips.com/sqlservertip/3586/sql-server-reporting-services-multilayer-pie-charts/#comments

Hi Jes, I’m wondering if you’ve come up with a way to save the custom color palette since this article was from a couple of years ago. I’m using 2014.
Thanks,

item.title: By: vee
item.dc:creator: vee
item.description: hi i know this is an old post, but how do you hard wire certain colours in a graph to a specific value when you have customized the colours?
item.content:encoded: hi i know this is an old post, but how do you hard wire certain colours in a graph to a specific value when you have customized the colours?
